website_summaries.verdict: An excellent solution for those in need of digital outputs for transferring analog audio to digital.
pros: A hybrid that serves as both preamplifier, and audio interface, this unit has a handy selection of analog and digital I/O, making it the ideal solution for transferring your record collection to digital formats
cons: This preamp does not include an AC adapter and relies on power via USB

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. It was easy to hook up and performed flawlessly. I could not detect any noise that it could have introduced into the circuit. I am using it to transfer vinyl albums to my computer. On playback of the WAV files I produced I could not tell I wasn't playing directly from the vinyl. Great product, way better than the cheap USB converters and cheaper than audiophile components whose performance advantage is WAY beyond my ability to hear.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis B. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great value, placement and grounding important
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, be sure the phono ground is fitted to the ground connection of the preamp. Also, I noticed the unit is very sensitive to where it is placed in relation to other electronic devices, emitting a faint to loud hum if near any of several devices (including my receiver, a network switch, and a cable box. Apparent lack of shielding on the preamp or these devices, or perhaps both. Otherwise does a nice job, useful gain helped me dial in my turntable volume. Don't really notice much effect of the low-pass filter or just my aging ears. Bothersome brightness on the LED indicators. Overall excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: RickSpeed

customer_reviews.title: REQUIRES COMPUTER CONNECTION FOR OPTICAL OUTPUT
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to be able to connect my phono turntable to my new receiver, which lacks a phono input but has digital optical inputs. Based on the description, I believed that this unit would take the phono input, run it through a RIAA preamp and output a digital optical signal. Unfortunately this unit ONLY gives optical output signal if connected to a computer... Don't want to dedicate a computer just to listen to records, so back it goes...
customer_reviews.author: RockDoc

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: When I'm spinning records it sounds great, but I have to unplug it otherwise because it generates way too much noise. At first I thought it might have to do with the grounding of my turntable, but it makes the same noise (not a hum) without anything plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Died after 12 months with occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Died after 12 months. Erratic signal at the input switch (far left) affects volume control. When it worked, it was just what I was looking for. Input switch as a little sketchy when I first got it, but worked fine after a little circular motion to find a sweet spot. Should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Cook

customer_reviews.title: This product works great in converting vinyl LP's to digital sound
customer_reviews.text: This product works great in converting vinyl LP's to digital sound. The Audacity software packed with it is quite robust with a lot of features but very marginal documentation as to how to use it or what the features do. Once gotten used to, it has proven to be an easy editor of tracks converted, but I still have to figure out what all the editing tools do and how to use them. I'll start exploring that issue once I have the conversions I want to do completed.
customer_reviews.author: DRJ

customer_reviews.title: High quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting vinyl and tape media into the computer. The unit switches between line and phono level inputs. If you have an appreciable analog music collection, this unit is more versatile than a stand-alone USB turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my direct drive, magnetic cartridge turn-table
customer_reviews.text: My pre-amp for magnetic cartridge that matches my high-end turntable went out. This unit is a perfect pre-amp replacement. And the USB direct connect (that is, built in ADC) made it all the better to more automatically convert old LP's (not available as CD's) to MP3's.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetSurplus

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: This item is a life saver. My receiver from my stereo for the 80s no longer functions. This preamp does the job for replacing it. All you need is a nice turntable and home entertainment system. Only minor thing that stinks about it is that you have to constantly unplug it to shut it off. There is no off switch. Also the item is labeled in hard to read colours of purple and green. Still worth the money, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: countess bathory

customer_reviews.title: Good item! The only problem is since it has ...
customer_reviews.text: Good item! The only problem is since it has a built in preamp, and I'm using two turntables and a mixer, and the mixer has a preamp built into it as well, it amplifies the sound a bit too much. It's borderline distortion. Not necessarily the products fault. I more or less need a lap top with audio in and not just USB's. Thus the reason for buying this product. Otherwise if you're connected turntable or other audio source to Phono Plus, you should have no problems! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Dean

customer_reviews.title: JACK OF ALL TRADES!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! The Little Engine That COULD! Well There Is No Shortage of Connections (Inputs and Outputs) Pretty Light Weight for a POWERHOUSE! Pre-Amp or DA Converter? Perhaps! I GIVE MY HIGHEST RECOMMENDATION thx00z.
customer_reviews.author: tommyhighextreme

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Dad, who has a huge LP collection. I got it all setup for him, leaving Phono Plus connected between the phonograph and his receiver on a wall wart. Then when he wants to run it with the PC, he can unplug the wart and receiver cables, and move the phono over to the desk and hook it up with usb. Works perfectly in both cases. Had no trouble at all recording his albums to mp3s so he can listen to his music on his ipod without rebuying it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LP,SP to digital made easyer...
customer_reviews.text: If u have old style turn table and want to convert old records to digital format this box will help u to pull the task.It is the middle man between turn table and pc or mac. If u have after all connection humming noise don't forget to ground the turn table. Process of converting to digital audio is simple,but it takes time. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Marcel Gapa

customer_reviews.title: Decent for money
customer_reviews.text: I have not really tried any other pre amps yet. I got this as a cheap temp amp. It does it's job. My only complaint is the fact that it's ADC is only 16 bit, which really is pointless in my opinion if ripping vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Rex McArtor

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-amp with a robust body and great functionality, but......
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few phono pre-amps over the years and this is hands down the best I've ever owned. Produces a very clean / buzz free signal into my powered speakers and my a/v receiver. Great functionality and an excellent way to catalogue your lp's to a digital format. The only flaws with this particular unit: a.) it has no on/off switch, it has to manually unplugged to turn it off AND b.) it is NOT shipped with a power supply/cord, that will have to be purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: I7

customer_reviews.title: No power supply
customer_reviews.text: The item did not come with power supply. The item details did not specify that it doesn’t come with power supply which is not fair for the seller. One way I feel deceived. When any one buys an electronic item it comes with power supply. If you buy a toy it says batteries included or requires batteries on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R K

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PHONO AMP!!!
customer_reviews.text: After in-depth research about many many Phono amps, this highly adjustable and feature-rich Awesome Amp is EVERYTHING advertised & MORE!! Simply put, it’s got InCREDIBLE overall sound improvement!!! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It came packaged with Sound Saver Express which is a very easy to use program that allows saving music files in ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the sound quality and ease of use. It came packaged with Sound Saver Express which is a very easy to use program that allows saving music files in different format and in 16 or 24bit. It will also import straight into iTunes or where ever you want. However the program stopped working after about 2 months - wouldn't launch. I reinstalled, worked for 2 months then stopped. This time reinstalling didn't help. I installed on another Mac and it worked for about 2 months. The manufacturer BIAS is out of business but someone else picked up support and they emailed the deluxe version to me at no charge, which has extra features and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: b9rob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. I use it for sampling vinyl and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. I use it for sampling vinyl and this is all you need other than the record player itself. Doubles as an audio interface! You probably sacrifice quite a bit of quality for all this but that's what you get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. You need to do a little research on 60 cycle hum and how to eliminate it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L Young

customer_reviews.title: Met my recording needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I'm over 60 and I can't hear frequencies above 8K Hz. That being said, I've got vinyl albums dating back to the 60s that I am digitizing. The sound quality I get through this preamp is very, very good. It can't be beat for the price. For those of you who are true audiophiles, maybe you can tell the subtle difference between this and a tube preamp, but, I can't. Too many concerts in my youth have taken away my ability to be discerning.
customer_reviews.author: William L Benton

customer_reviews.title: USB Only
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge problem, I have plenty of USB-to-AC adapters laying around the house, but if you don't and intend to use this preamp with a regular stereo system (as I do) just know that you may have to purchase a DC adapter. Other than that, it's fine for the money. I particularly like using it through my headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: recommend it
customer_reviews.text: First bought the NAD pp4, sent that back and bought this, more than half the price, works fantastic, I'm slowly plowing through my record collection, using this plus vinyl studio. Only con, which seems insignificant, is I have no idea what the 2 optical jacks and 1 spdif jack do. And didn't find the manual pages for these adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of DVD to digital converters out there, but few devices that let you transfer records to digital. This product works with any version of Roxio that accepts analog input, or the open source Audacity. I have a collection of all of Mozart's symphonies. I used this and Audacity to convert the entire set so I could listen to it on an MP3 player. There is nothing like riding the twisty roads in the mountains with the Jupiter symphony playing in your helmet!
customer_reviews.author: Grimjaw

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for my turntable.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in to my PC and in an instant it was working. Windows 10
customer_reviews.author: William Kendall

customer_reviews.title: The resulting digitized vinyl sounds great, but the quality control seems to be poor
customer_reviews.text: The resulting digitized vinyl sounds great, but the quality control seems to be poor. The left channel started dropping out after a week of light usage. Upon power cycling, I could hear hissing and crackling on the left channel, from both the preamp and headphone outputs.It sounds like failing electronics.
customer_reviews.author: SoundmanNH

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Reproduction!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and is connected between my Sony front-Loader and Pioneer Elite 7.2 Received on CD input. Like being able to adjust output since nearly every album has a different recording bias. I would have given 5 of 5 stars if there was a power on/off switch/button and USB was on front. Otherwise ... Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: My turntable lives again!!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to tap into the digital recording capabilities, but just having this as a nice, powerful, very small pre-amp for my turntable has been outstanding! I've been able to get my 1980 Technics SL-Q303 turntable back on-line and hooked into my Bose Acoustimass speaker system via good old RCA jacks without needing a full on receiver/amplifier and a lot of extra space. I've really enjoyed listening to my old albums from end to end as they were meant to be heard.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy in Bellevue WA

customer_reviews.title: Works well, have not used usb function,
customer_reviews.text: Works well, have not used usb function, I needed a pre-amp with a headphone line out to plug into Bose Sound Dock
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Adlam

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The device was defective right out of the box as the Optical output did not function. This was the primary reason I bought this was to have an adjustable gain, analog (composite-RCA) to digital (Optical) conversion. The other functions appeared to operate fine but did not suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Vinylville

customer_reviews.title: USB Disables certain recording programs features.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and compressed sounding. I was attempting to use it with Feltip's Soundstudio audio recording program for Mac OSX.6 but the interface with the ART USB disabled the levels feature. That makes recording level control during recording useless. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gill

customer_reviews.title: nice device, so so software
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality product. It performs flawlessly and is easy to use. I'm using it to record my LPs to MP3s. The software is mediocre and I'm currently evaluating other software before I jump completely into my LP archiving project..
customer_reviews.author: Carlton B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Device!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device. It does an excellent job digitizing the output from my direct drive turntable, which is 32 years old. It was very easy to set up on my MAC. I was up and running in just a few minutes. The cost was very reasonable in comparison to USB turntables. Construction is solid. There aren't too many items nowadays that are made out of metal but the enclosure and gain trim knob for this device are! For those who already have a turntable, this device is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great price to performance ratio.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap preamp and this fell towards the top of my budget, I am glad that I shelled out the extra cash. The unit installed on its own and I had it working within a few minutes. I made some recordings with audacity, everything was simple - 98% of the time this thing is used as just a regular preamp however its nice to have the option to record. This did not come with a wall socket, the only cable included was USB.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This little converter makes great digital recordings of my old LP's. Very easy to set-up and use. I have a moving coil cartridge on my turntable so I just use the cable that goes to the input on a cassette recorder to deliver the increased signal necessary for the Art Interface. I highly recommend this little device. Works great as a headphone amp as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Varon

customer_reviews.title: ART USB preamp
customer_reviews.text: This little gem not only amplifies my turntable output better than my Onkyo receiver/amp, it makes turning my old LP's into CD's a snap. Let me qualify the snap part. You have to download the free Audacity software since the software sent with the preamp, BIAS Soundsaver express, does not work. They should just instruct you to go on-line and down load Audacity.
customer_reviews.author: noname

customer_reviews.title: There are enough extensive reviews on here. You only ...
customer_reviews.text: There are enough extensive reviews on here. You only need to know this: This thing does what it advertises and does it well!
customer_reviews.author: J. Taone

customer_reviews.title: Easy, versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this briefly so far, but everything about it has performed quite well. It has the ability to take a variety of inputs, including RCA and fiber optic, adjust gain and bass cutout (to eliminate turntable rumble) and feed it all straight into the PC. The included freeware software was easy to install and relatively simple to use. All in all, I'm very pleased! It will simplify converting my LP and tape collections to MP3, and I may even use it as an ongoing interface between my audio system and my PC, because it's much better than the standard 1/8" jack on the audio card!
customer_reviews.author: D. Fabish

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the money. Should have been double boxed when it was shipped.
customer_reviews.author: James U.

customer_reviews.title: Great product...Does what I needed it to do...Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in order to play albums through my surround sound system. This product works perfectly and does everything I need it to do. I have not used the USB function yet.
customer_reviews.author: CMP

customer_reviews.title: Good all around unit...except it did not come with power source
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get back into playing my old albums and needed a preamp to do so because the phono jack of my receiver was not working and could not be fixed. I choose this unit because it would not only serve my purpose but allow me to convert the albums and possibly some cassettes to my ipod. It meets my needs but because it was not clear in the write up that the external power source (other than your PC) was not included. I had to order one separately. I would recommend this unit....if you don't need the power source.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Scandle

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade!
customer_reviews.text: This is much more than a basic phono pre-amp (which is my main purpose). Hardware quality is excellent. Both the phono and USB output signals are extremely clean. The adjustable premap with clipping indicator light allows me to get the best possible signal without cutting off any sound. This would be impossible to determine with a more basic preamp. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Wrape

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit but no more free adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit so obviously I am happy with it. However it seems ART has gone cheap as they no longer include the 9 volt power adapter with the unit. You have to buy it as an extra. My first unit bought a year ago had it included.
customer_reviews.author: sam17704

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing, great for use with USB with Win Vista x64, using the last version of Audacity 1.3.13 beta, with the USB Stereo/mono sounds great, inclusive when the Computer -> ART Preamp or ART Preamp -> Computer, sharing audio and this is digitalized.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Leave "sound saver" disc out of package
customer_reviews.text: The USB Phono Plus PS device performed as claimed and I am pleased with the device. However, the disc that was enclosed "Bias Sound Saver" disc was a total waste of time: it would not load properly following all the instructions; website is down; phone numbers provided for help are not operable; etcetera. Forget the disc.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good preamp and converter.
customer_reviews.text: Good phono pre-amp. Low noise and very flexible. Gain trim is a plus. I use it with my Pro-Ject Carbon.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, simple to use, solved my needs. I hooked this to a Stanton T.92 USB and now I can sample off my vinyl collection.
customer_reviews.author: Annette M.

customer_reviews.title: Technically it does not include everthing needed to use it right out of the box.  AC power supply not included
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was average, nice gain feature, doesn't reproduce nice sounding bass compared to other phono amplifiers. Doesn't include a friggen AC power adapter. When I opened the box and found way to power it up I thought there was a mistake, so I called the company and they said "it is an optional part". "It is powered through USB, use the supplied cord" they said. So technically this DOES NOT come with everything needed to use it. You must supply your own USB power supply or purchase an "optional" power adapter, lame.
customer_reviews.author: Logan W.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: get my old turntable putting sounds thru the stereo system
customer_reviews.author: Ray Rumble

customer_reviews.title: Used this to convert all of my LPs to digital ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to convert all of my LPs to digital files with relative ease. Works as advertised and gives a lot of control over the process...
customer_reviews.author: J. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Can listen to my records again. Record them too.
customer_reviews.text: I got so I could listen to my records on my computer because I live in a small apartment and didn't have space for a receiver. It works as advertised. The manual provides great details for setup, I thought the levels were a bit low so I turned them up a little in the control panel. I have yet to install the included software, but will update once I have had a chance to use it. SO far everything seems great.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Third one I've bought. Great for converting analog to digital.
customer_reviews.author: khoffcran

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a great value and gets the job done with total control and flexibility. The included music recording program was user friendly enough to make it easy to convert my albums to itunes and use across all my devices!
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Egbert

customer_reviews.title: ART USB Phono Plus is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have struggled digitising many vinyl records, reel to reel tapes and cassette tapes to CD. With the recent purchase of the ART USB Phono Plus, the recordings have been painless. It is so easy to use and the recordings appear to be as good, or even better, than any commercial remastered CD. The unit comes with an editing program but I chose to use Audacity - a free open source audio editor - instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bojer

customer_reviews.title: worked great for that purpose
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to put my vinal records on CD's...........worked great for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: EsyRider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Really improves the sound quality of vinyl-to-CD ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Really improves the sound quality of vinyl-to-CD finished product!
customer_reviews.author: CTin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It does what ii's supposed to do and I am capturing vinyl albums to a hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Will Rip

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough about how useful this preamp /Converter has been
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about how useful this preamp /Converter has been. Use it almost every day and it works perfectly and the converters are of very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: George M Bensmiller

customer_reviews.title: It has worked as promised
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews on different components that could help me dub my vinyl LPs, and cassette tapes to mp3, and narrowed it down to about 3 products. In the end a good written review from another customer, and price range considerations, swayed me to the ART USB Phono plus. It has worked great, it has been easy to use, and I have been very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Velez

customer_reviews.title: Very clean sound
customer_reviews.text: I have never heard my record player so clearly! Great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kreg E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect just took a minute to get it figured out without static.
customer_reviews.author: Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is great. Excellent as a phone preamp. And outstanding as a USB interface to digitize audio. I've been tranferring old cassettes of my own jams onto my computer. The software supplied makes it very easy to not only transfer, but to edit, filter, etc. A great deal!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Space Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp
customer_reviews.text: I use this amp to move music from vinyl to CD. It sits between a Dual Turntable and a notebook computer. This device delivers. I can not find any fault with it. Sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: VinylMan

customer_reviews.title: USB Phono Plus
customer_reviews.text: I give this product 4 out of 5 stars because, it is easy to set up, use and the price is affordable. Negative features is the "noise reduction feature" the music sounds very "FLAT" once it is played back from your computer. Because of this I finalize the transfer of the file with out any noise reduction. A great product for the people whom are strapped with what do with all of those old albums sitting in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: daryl

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is fantastic. I am using this purely as a phono preamp to my stereo. The only way I can describe this is to say that my records sound vibrant and alive. I just bought a tube amp, rolled some tubes, and haven't reached the end of the amount of detail this Art preamp has. The soundstage doesn't seem to have a limit, it's that good. What I'm trying to say is that I really don't think you can buy a better pre amp for any amount of money. I could be wrong, but I don't know how you could improve on this.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to connect an older turntable to a newer receiver...this did the job. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: What a great little product. I have over 500 lps. Converting many of them. This does a great job
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Performs just as expected! Well made and a great piece of equipment! Great price also.
customer_reviews.author: Shutter Bugg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews were spot on. This thing is the best - simple to use and produces great sound with the free Audacity software. Converting LP & cassette to MP3 files (with free Lame add on to Audacity), drop into Itunes and they play amazing. Love the ability to control the gain going in to eliminate clipping on my high output albums and the head phone jack to monitor input. Running XP Pro SP3 on Dell with SoundMax Audio Card and have had zero problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value for the money
customer_reviews.text: A nice sound card Was bought for Analog MagiK software
customer_reviews.author: Savvas Kontrafouris

customer_reviews.title: ART V2 USB Phono Plus
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit to use my turntable with new Yamaha RX-V867 AVR since it does not have a dedicated phono input. Plug TT into preamp and plug pream into analog audio input on receiver - works perfectly. Added functionality is to convert my vinyl to digital format! I have not yet used it to convert to digital so no input there. Product fills the main purpose for which it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: ItsmeItsme

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very high quality device for such a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use at a very good price for a device of this quality and functionality. The sampling bit rate is moderate but high enough to produce very good quality recordings from your classic vinyl albums or other analog sources. You will pay a substantial premium for a device with a higher sampling rate, and most people may not be able to tell the difference in sound quality. The headphone monitoring feature is nice. I've also read earlier reviews suggesting that the dials and labels were hard to read either due to text color or size, but it seems these issues have been corrected. I find the labels to be easy to read and intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Coghlan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a newer stereo with no phono input. Good audio software too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: ART V2 USB Phono Plus DJ Preamp
customer_reviews.text: Thus far this device has performed as advertised and I highly recommend its purchase by others interested in copying music from cassette, records and reel to reel tape players. It arrived within the stated time frame and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: It does what its supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I found this by chance. I ordered it as it was the least expensive way for a novice to get my records recorded. Hardware set up was simple. I had one question about settings and a quick call to the maker answered my questions and recommended appropriate settings. The software (freeware) for recording/saving was very simple. I went to their web site for more instructions(printed them)It is not fancy software as I save each record in a file. I cannot and do not wish to list each song. I like to play albums not songs
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence friedman

customer_reviews.title: Good USB Phono product
customer_reviews.text: I already started to record my 45s to a flash drive. This product met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: preamplifier to buy
customer_reviews.text: Great interface between phonograph and computer. All you need is audacity software and conversion is easy. I have successfully converted records to digital files.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: But it is a great bit of gear that gives good results on a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit primarily because I expected it to work "out of the box" on my Ubuntu computer (based on other reviews), and it didn't. But it is a great bit of gear that gives good results on a Windows computer.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Oates

customer_reviews.title: Untested, Appears good quality; Different Software than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Initial not-yet-used comment: Software on CD (2014) titled "ART Installation CD v.1.5" in box includes Audacity (not Soundwave Express as advertised). Paper User Manual and USB cable also in box. Shipped in ART original carton with shipping self-adhesive label stuck on top, where some text and graphics are located. Label was carefully removed with help of low-temp hair dryer. Little to no residue remained. Actual device is compact and feels sturdy.

customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I love my old vinyl and this has made the transfer to digital easy. It exports in WAV or MP3 formats and has some editing abilities I have yet to master. I have enjoyed this simple solution to transfer my albums to digital recordings. My one complaint is that there is no on/off switch.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for the beloved LP's records
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and looked real professional. It was difficult to use it with windows 7, but on XP it works perfectly. Anu suggetions for Win7? It keeps the original sound of the record, and i guess that with a little practice you can even lose some of the background noise of LP's. It has a transformer (watch out - it's a 110V), but can use the USB connection as a power supply instead. Now you just need to have the time for converting your beloved records to CD's.

product_meta.title: ART USB Phono Plus
product_meta.description: USB Phono Plus Project Series. The USB Phono Plus from ART is the ideal solution for transferring your highly prized vinyl collection to your computer or laptop, and also works great as an audio interface between analog and digital sources. The built in low-noise RIAA phono pre-amp circuit features low cut filters (to remove rumble and noise) that will help achieve clean transfers. Front-mounted gain control and Signal/Clip LED allows easy optimization of a wide range of analog input sources. The USB Monitor/headphone provides zero latency monitoring of the input source for easy cueing. The USB Phono Plus can also act as audio playback source for any USB equipped computer or laptop. Optical TOSLINK input and output as well as an S/PDIF input make the USB Phono Plus an ideal analog / digital audio to USB interface as well. Housed in an all aluminum black anodized case, the USB Phono Plus can be powered by either external power supply or directly via USB port. To ensure maximum versatility, the USB Phono Plus is fully compliant with the USB 2.0 specification and uses USB adaptive mode for playback and USB asynchronous mode for record. It will work with Windows 98SE/ME/2000/XP/Vista/7 USB audio device drivers as well as Apple OS9.1/OS-X computers with native USB support.
feature_bullets: Easily transfer audio from your vinyl records to your laptop or computerAlso functions as an audio interface between analog and digital sourcesFront mounted gain control and Signal/Clip LEDUSB Phono Plus ships with Sound Saver Express software
